i5.las2peer.tools

Class L2pNodeLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • i5.las2peer.tools.L2pNodeLauncher

  • public class L2pNodeLauncher
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the LAS2peer node launcher functionalities. All methods to be executed can be stated via additional command line parameters to the main(java.lang.String[]) method.

      • shutdown

      • uploadStartupDirectory

        public void uploadStartupDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
        Uploads the contents of the given directory to the global storage of the LAS2peer network. Each contained .xml-file is used as an artifact or - in case the name of the file starts with agent- - as an agent to upload. If agents are to be uploaded, make sure, that the startup directory contains a passphrases.txt file giving the passphrases for the agents.
        Parameters:
        directory -

      • uploadStartupDirectory

        public void uploadStartupDirectory()
        Upload the contents of the startup sub directory to the global storage of the LAS2peer network. Each contained .xml-file is used as an artifact or - in case the name of the file starts with agent- - as an agent to upload. If agents are to be uploaded, make sure, that the startup directory contains a passphrases.txt file giving the passphrases for the agents.

      • registerUserAgent

        public boolean registerUserAgent(java.lang.String id,
                                 java.lang.String passphrase)
        Try to register the user of the given id at the node and for later usage in this launcher, i.e. for service method calls via invoke(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).
        Parameters:
        id - id or login of the agent to load
        passphrase - passphrase to unlock the private key of the agent
        Returns:
        the registered agent

      • registerUserAgent

        public void registerUserAgent(UserAgent agent)
                       throws L2pSecurityException,
                              AgentAlreadyRegisteredException,
                              AgentException
        Register the given agent at the LAS2peer node and for later usage with invoke(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String). Make sure, that the private key of the agent is unlocked before registering
        Parameters:
        agent -
        Throws:
        L2pSecurityException
        AgentAlreadyRegisteredException
        AgentException

      • registerUserAgent

        public void registerUserAgent(UserAgent agent,
                              java.lang.String passphrase)
                       throws L2pSecurityException,
                              AgentException
        Register the given agent at the LAS2peer node and for later usage with invoke(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String). If the private key of the agent is not unlocked and a pass phrase has been given, an attempt to unlock the key is started before registering.
        Parameters:
        agent -
        passphrase -
        Throws:
        L2pSecurityException
        AgentAlreadyRegisteredException
        AgentException

      • unregisterCurrentAgent

        public void unregisterCurrentAgent()
        Unregister the current user from the LAS2peer node and from this launcher.
        See Also:
        registerUserAgent(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • invoke

        public java.io.Serializable invoke(java.lang.String serviceIdentifier,
                                   java.lang.String serviceMethod,
                                   java.lang.String parameters)
                            throws L2pServiceException
        Invokes a service method as the current agent, choosing an approptiate service version. The arguments must be passed via ONE String separated by "-".
        Parameters:
        serviceIdentifier -
        serviceMethod -
        parameters - pass an empty string if you want to call a method without parameters
        Returns:
        Throws:
        L2pServiceException - any exception during service method invocation
        See Also:
        registerUserAgent(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • getServiceMethods

        public ListMethodsContent getServiceMethods(java.lang.String serviceNameVersion)
                                     throws L2pSecurityException,
                                            AgentNotKnownException,
                                            java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                            EncodingFailedException,
                                            SerializationException,
                                            TimeoutException
        Returns a list of available methods for the given service class name.
        Parameters:
        serviceNameVersion - Exact service name and version, same syntax as in startService(String)
        Returns:
        list of methods encapsulated in a ListMethodsContent
        Throws:
        L2pSecurityException
        AgentNotKnownException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        SerializationException
        EncodingFailedException
        TimeoutException

      • startService

        public java.lang.String startService(java.lang.String serviceNameVersion)
                              throws L2pServiceException
        Generate a new ServiceAgent instance for the given service class and start an instance of this service at the current LAS2peer node.
        Parameters:
        serviceNameVersion - Specify the service name and version to run: package.serviceClass@Version. Exact match required.
        Returns:
        Returns the passphrase of the generated ServiceAgent or null if the agent is already known.
        Throws:
        L2pServiceException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                        MalformedXMLException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        L2pSecurityException,
                        EncodingFailedException,
                        SerializationException,
                        NodeException
        Main method for command line processing. The method will start a node and try to invoke all command line parameters as parameterless methods of this class. Hint: with "log-directory=.." you can set the logfile directory you want to use. Hint: with "service-directory=.." you can set the directory your service jars are located at.
        Parameters:
        argv -
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        MalformedXMLException
        java.io.IOException
        L2pSecurityException
        EncodingFailedException
        SerializationException
        NodeException
